name: 亞太地區人力資源專題研究
description: In the wake of completing this course, participants are expected to be able to:   1.Identify research problems in the field of Asia Pacific Human Resource development.  2.Understand the principles and processes involved in developing and addressing a specific research question. 3.Design research plans and processes. 4.Use relevant literature and other resources for research projects.
goals: 隨者東西冷戰的結束與國際共產集團的式微，國際關係的體質產生了巨大的變化。全球所關注的安全焦點已轉為經濟貿易、環境、能源、恐怖主義等議題，非軍事性因素被廣泛納入國家安全的概念中思考；區域經濟整合機制的出現，反映各國對其安全意涵擴大的構思。
為避免台灣在全球，特別是東南亞被邊陲化的危機，本課程研究核心分為：台灣經濟發展、中國經濟發展及兩岸經貿互動等三個單元。我國面對貿易全球化時代的來臨，兩岸經貿關係的穩定擴大，不僅影響兩岸關係之互動與發展，亦將影響我國與其他地區之經貿互動。
非屬傳統規範的國家安全因素，應予以重新界定，並納入國家安全意涵中，方能達成我國家安全長久利益之目標。
面對經貿全球一體化的時代來臨，區域經濟整合不僅是攸關技術、資本在區域或國際市場間的高速流動，更包括以管理與策略性高級人力資本的跨國移動。本專題研究重點係針對新興的亞太地區國家為主軸針對區域性人力資源如何轉變為人力資本進行深入探索。
syllabus:
16+2 weeks: The first sixteen weeks will instruct the concepts and knowledge from various sources (e.g., textbook, journal articles, casebook, and etc.) and the last two weeks will conduct critical analysis and reflection on various practical cases related to the content of the first sixteen weeks

1 week：Special Topics in Asia Pacific Human Resources  
2 week：What is "work" today and why effective HR management is importnat?  
3 week：Why good managers are so rare? 100 best companies to work for model  
4 week：Managing different generational workers  
5 week：Diversity management  
6 week：Sexual harassment and discrimination  
7 week：Transaction cost and exchange theory  
8 week：HR planning  
9 week：Job analysis, Job description, Job design  
10 week：Recruiting and Selection  
11 week：Interviewing  
12 week：Training and Development  
13 week：Retention  
14 week：Performance Management  
15 week：Discipline and termination  
16 week：Compensation and Benefit  
17 week：Case study discussion and reflection  
18 week：Case study discussion and reflection

methodologies.note: This course will be taught using PowerPoint slides and relevant video clips
Students will be divided into groups to discuss the assigned topics in the class
Students will conduct various group activities relevant with HRD and HRM practices
